result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brad L Scheibe was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The fine is $3468.00 to be paid as condition of extended supervision.

$65.00 County blood draw costs to be paid as condition of extended supervision.

DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge to be paid as condition of extended supervision unless done so already.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant deceased 8/26/21; unpaid court obligations of $3,735.00

11:33 AM Defendant, Brad L Scheibe, appeared by video Zoom. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video Zoom. Defendant had filed a request to modify the JOC. State opposed with argument. Statement by defendant. State responded and opposed any reduction in the extended supervision. Court found no basis to reduce the length of the sentence. Denied the request to reduce or eliminate the fine/costs. The motion filed by defendant is denied. 11:55 AM
Motion hearing on March 8, 2021 at 11:30 am. Additional notice mailed to the defendant at the address on record.
Per plea/sentencing hearing held on 5-29-15

Defendant is not eligibel for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Brad L Scheibe in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to OWI-8th.  Court finds defendant guilty and enters JOC.  Court  imposes: 8 years prison with 3 years initial and 5 years extended supervision.consecutive to any other sentence. Conds of ES: $3468.00, 36 month revocation and 36 month IID, $65.00 blood draw costs, AODA,  DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge unless already done.  Count 2 is dismissed. Not eligible to the challenge  program, eligible for substance abuse program.   Defendant may withdraw plea if he wishes.  0 jail credit.

Defendant, Brad L Scheibe, appeared in custody pro se, requested time to get an attorney. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Time limits explained. Court adjourned; call to be placed to public defender office. Case recalled, same appearances. Atty. Masana with defendant now, stated he was just appointed.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued. Twenty days to file motions.
Atty Peter Masana
